race.name: Lauf Gritfest
race.tagline: Welsh mountain gravel in Cambrian Mountains.

climate.description: Variable mountain conditions with rain possible.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Cambrian Mountains. Significant elevation with mountain scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional UK event. Welsh mountain terrain is nice but moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Lauf Gritfest is a regional event in Cambrian Mountains, Wales—mountain terrain with significant elevation. The Welsh mountain scenery is nice, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. Wales provides moderate access. Weather variability is a challenge.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional UK gravel race with Welsh mountain terrain. Worth it for UK cyclists seeking a mountain event. Not a destination race for international travelers.

final_verdict.one_liner: Welsh mountain gravel in Cambrian Mountains.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in the UK and want a Welsh mountain event—yes, it's solid. If you're international—there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better UK events: Dirty Reiver. For similar mountain events: other UK gravel races.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Limited lodging in Cambrian Mountains area.

course_description.character: Welsh mountain gravel with significant climbing.
course_description.signature_challenge: Welsh mountain climbing in Cambrian Mountains.

non_negotiables.why: Welsh mountains require solid climbing fitness (6000 feet).
Welsh weather is variable with rain possible.

marketplace_variables.race_hook: Welsh mountain gravel in Cambrian Mountains.

logistics.explanation: Registration Friday afternoon and Saturday morning, gates lock at 22:00, camping opens Friday noon. Emily Tillett notes mechanicals that 'put the overall out of reach' — plan your support accordingly in rural Carmarthenshire where backup options are thin. As Emily Tillett puts it: "With no phone signal at the campsite, the social side carries on into the evening, with people sitting around and sharing stories from the day. It feels more like a weekend away than a race weekend."

length.explanation: 128km across three days hits the sweet spot for stage racing. Rachel Sokal learned to 'do a bit less chatting and a bit more breathing on the transition climb' — those untimed sections between stages still demand pacing discipline. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Rachel Sokal describes 'nearly 20 km of undulating trails on ever changing grades of gravel' as epic terrain. Access to Day 1's final stage requires 'winching up a 20% gradient climb' — this isn't fire road gravel. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds. As Rachel Sokal puts it: "Day two was a much drier and shorter affair although the 60 km route included 1,500 m of climbing, which meant I continued to curse my relaxed attitude to selecting gearing."

elevation.explanation: 6km of 'gradual uphill' proved 'torturous' even for competitive rider Rachel Sokal, who regretted her 'usual flat-riding gearing' throughout both days. Day 2's 1,500m climbing across 60km maintains the Welsh mountain punishment. More climbing than SBT GRVL at the same score. As Rachel Sokal puts it: "The 6 km of gradual uphill was a torturous lesson to me that I not only should have gone for a smaller chain ring, I probably should have done a bit less chatting and a bit more breathing on the trans..."

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 62°F and lows of 48°F, with a 66% chance of rain on any given day. The 2022 forecast predicted 'torrential rain for the first 24 hours' and delivered — riders raced Saturday in full waterproofs after 'dry skies early on lulled riders into a false sense of security before the heavens opened.' More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Cambrian Mountains deliver climbing without altitude effects. The challenge here is gradient and volume, not thin air — even the highest points won't affect your oxygen levels. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Three-day camping in the Cambrian Mountains with stages through remote terrain like Cwm Berwen. The final stage features 'a spectacular fast descent on a winding track through an old lead mine' with no chance to stop and appreciate it.

prestige.explanation: Elite riders like Emily Tillett compete here, but she won a stage while dealing with mechanicals — suggesting the field depth allows breakthrough performances. Seven editions deep, it's established regionally but lacks broader recognition.

race_quality.explanation: Emily Tillett summarizes it perfectly: 'Day 1 brought both mechanical issues and a stage win — a pretty good summary of gravel: highs and lows in a single ride.' The format works, execution has rough edges.

experience.explanation: The rally-style format creates 'rolling social rides' between timed stages rather than constant racing pressure. Most route is untimed, letting riders pace the transfers and focus energy on the competitive sections.

community.explanation: Emily Tillett notes 'with no phone signal at the campsite, the social side carries on into the evening, with people sitting around and sharing stories from the day. It feels more like a weekend away than a race weekend.' As Rachel Sokal puts it: "Despite the weather there was a cheery atmosphere and plenty of excited chat between riders as we rolled out along the idyllic Welsh country lanes."

field_depth.explanation: 400 riders with elite competitors like Emily Tillett mixing with recreational riders. The gravel ethos means 'wear what works, ride at the pace that suits you' — competitive but not cutthroat depth. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: £120 gets you three days of Welsh wilderness racing plus camping, but Rachel Sokal highlights extras like 'spot prizes from the sponsors, the gravy on the chips or the dodgy dancing' as part of the weekend package.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs £80-120. Rural Wales location means driving hours from major cities and camping by necessity. Rachel Sokal packed 'multiple pairs of riding shoes and an almost infinite combination of sleeves and waterproofs' — gear redundancy costs add up. Higher total cost than Badlands.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: My Unforgettable Adventure at Lauf Gritfest 2023: Conquering the Cambrian Mountains!
videos.description:
My Unforgettable Adventure at Lauf Gritfest 2023: Conquering the Brecon Beacons!

June saw me heading to Lauf Gritfest 2023, the first-ever gravel bike festival held in the majestic Brecon Beacons. In this YouTube video, join me and my group of friends as we push our limits, celebrate camaraderie, and revel in the joy of adventure.

https://acycling.com/
https://gritfest.co.uk/

From the very first pedal stroke, the trails of the Brecon Beacons challenged us in ways we had never anticipated. But with every tough climb and exhilarating descent, we discovered newfound strength within ourselves. The training I had put in leading up to the festival truly paid off, and I couldn't have been prouder of my accomplishments.

In this video, I invite you to witness the raw emotions I experienced throughout the festival. From the exhaustion and determination etched on my face during grueling climbs to the sheer joy radiating from me as I conquered the demanding trails, you'll see the rollercoaster of emotions that defined my Lauf Gritfest journey.

However, Lauf Gritfest is not just about the physical aspect. It's about the connections we forge and the sense of community we embrace. My friends and I laughed, cheered, and shared stories around the campfire, forming bonds that will last a lifetime. Through this video, you'll feel the warmth and inclusivity of the gravel biking community, inspiring you to join in on the adventure.

The Brecon Beacons, with their awe-inspiring landscapes, provided the perfect backdrop for our gravel biking escapades. Join me as I navigate the rugged terrains, taking you through breathtaking valleys and conquering awe-inspiring peaks. The visuals alone will ignite your wanderlust and encourage you to explore the great outdoors on your own gravel biking expeditions.

Whether you're an experienced gravel biker seeking inspiration or someone looking to dip their toes into the world of adventure cycling, this video is a must-watch. Lauf Gritfest 2023 was an extraordinary journey filled with passion, triumph, and unforgettable memories that will forever hold a special place in my heart.

Don't miss the opportunity to experience the thrill of Lauf Gritfest through my eyes. Subscribe to my channel, hit the notification bell, and be the first to witness my latest videos as I continue to delve into the world of adventure sports and share my extraordinary journeys with you. Let's embrace the spirit of gravel biking together!

*AI description!

#LaufGritfest #GravelBiking #BreconBeacons #AdventureCycling #OutdoorExploration

videos.title: Gritfest - The UK's Premier Gravel Event
videos.description:
Held in the heart of Wales within the Cambrian Mountains, Gritfest is a 2 day gravel event.
Gritfest is the UK's premier gravel cycle race taking in some incredible scenery, great social vibe and a bit of racing for those who are competitive too.

Featuring 3 timed special stages each day as an "enduro" style format it creates a fun and relaxed atmosphere between riders. Camping, entertainment, beer and loads to enjoy!

#gritfest

videos.title: Gritfest Gravel Race - Mid Wales
videos.description:
Gritfest will take place on June 18th & 19th, 2022.
Entries open December 1st, 2021.

Gritfest is the UK's biggest and best gravel race, taking place from the village of Cilycwm in the heart of the Cambrian Mountains.

The race includes 6 timed stages over 2 days and is designed to be a true gravel race, that is to say, fastest on a true gravel bike. Stage vary in distance and terrain with a mix of undulating and downhill based stages planned for 2022.

Full information at gritfest.co.uk

#gritfest #gritfest2021 #gritfest2022 #gravelrace

quotes.text: The short 5K prologue section involves some pretty gnarly and some pretty technical sections and really showed what those amazing riders can do with their bikes.

Towards the end of Saturday's stage was an insane climb it was completely brutal and nobody was talking to each other and what followed was an insane descent even some of the best descenders I've seen off-road riders were really struggling with that.
On the Saturday and the Sunday the first time sections had some pretty big queues waiting 35-40 minutes to get started.

key_challenges.name: Insane climb
key_challenges.description: Completely brutal climb towards the end of Saturday's stage where nobody was talking to each other, followed by an insane descent that even the best off-road descenders were struggling with

key_challenges.name: First section off road
key_challenges.description: First section of off-road terrain that's quite greasy, requiring gravel tires

key_challenges.name: Prologue technical sections
key_challenges.description: 5K prologue with pretty gnarly and technical sections like single track, described as hardcore with crazy climbs before, after and during them

terrain_notes.text: First section off the road is quite greasy, requiring careful handling with gravel tires
Incredible trails through woods and around reservoirs that give an overwhelming sense of freedom, nothing like the technicality of the prologue
After dropping tire pressure to about 14 at the soup stop, the gravel runs a lot smoother

gear_mentions.text: Running Gravel King 650 by 48 tires on 650B wheels - not as quick as 700C but more insurance against things that go bump in the night
Six LEDs on handlebars with factory bag battery give really good vision even on low power because the light beams overlap, providing good contact for night sections
Dropped front tire pressure to about 14 at the soup stop which made the gravel run much smoother

race_day_tips.text: There are 35-40 minute queues waiting to get started at the first time sections on Saturday and Sunday
Consider not stopping at the end of time sections to regroup and at every feed station if your body doesn't work well with frequent stops - just keep riding
Keep lights on low power setting for night sections to eke out battery life

rider_intel.search_text: Lauf Gritfest in the Cambrian Mountains features a challenging 65km Saturday stage with 1350 meters of climbing through incredible trails around woods and reservoirs. The course includes a brutal climb towards the end followed by a technical descent that challenges even experienced off-road riders. The prologue is particularly gnarly with hardcore single track sections. Riders report the first off-road section is quite greasy requiring careful handling. Night sections are possible with proper lighting. Long queues of 35-40 minutes form at time section starts on weekend stages. The terrain feels much smoother when tire pressure is dropped to around 14 PSI. Riders describe an overwhelming sense of freedom on the gravel tracks, though frequent stops at time sections and feed stations can disrupt rhythm for some participants.
